caption:
This photograph captures a serene winter scene focusing on a dense forest during a snowfall. In the foreground, you can see mounds of pristine snow, suggesting an untouched natural landscape. The main subjects of the image are the tall, slender trees that stand vertically throughout the frame. These trees, which lack leaves, have thin trunks and a few branches, indicative of a cold weather environment where deciduous trees have shed their foliage.

The background is a mix of more tightly packed trees that create a textured look due to the intertwining branches. The atmosphere is thick with falling snow, which blurs and softens the background, enhancing the feeling of depth in the forest setting. The snowfall adds a dynamic element to the scene as it appears to blanket the trees and the ground heavily. The overall mood conveyed is quiet and isolated, a peaceful yet chilly winter day where the dominant colors are the whites of the snow and the dark tones of the tree trunks, with subtle hints of blue throughout due to the lighting or photographic technique used.
title: Eighty year old regrowth Douglas fir in the snow.  Taken on vancouver island, british Columbia near port alberni, british Columbia, canada.  From the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, "in praise of forests".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  January, 1974.
